website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy and reliable with good-quality color printing at a price that will tempt inkjet stalwarts to jump to laser printing.
pros: Speedy and streamlined, this printer looks great in any office, churning out up to 33 ppm
Its cost-control functions are a big bonus, including active directory support and NFC card reader to limit printing to authorized users
cons: Setting up WiFi may be tricky in mixed-OS offices (Mac and Windows), but works well once connected

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. This printer color is awful, I had techs work on it several times with no solution. Colors cannot be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: linda faye goss

customer_reviews.title: Print Color is off and way too dark Brother has not yet been able to correct it
customer_reviews.text: Prints fast and great for documents. However, the color printing is way off and way too dark. I have spoken with Brother and they could not solve the issue so it is being escalated. When I print anything in color it prints very dark. For example a royal blue color looks navy blue and a bright pink looks maroon. Hopefully they can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Christal Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to Wifi or devices well, slow downloading when it does connect means slow printing
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever had over 30 years. It is supposed to connect to the wifi, but only worked when it was initially plugged in. After any idle time you have to unplug and plug in for it to be recognized, and now even that isn't working even though it says it is connected to the network. Also the direct connect feature does not work at all with Apple products. After trying for hours I just gave up. Finally, when it did connect, it took minutes for each page to download from my computer to the printer. Literally minutes. When finally downloaded it did print fine.
customer_reviews.author: aquaholic

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday in a small office that is fairly paper intensive. The only ding is that I dislike the need to (1) hunt for settings occasionally to (a) duplex print or (b) print labels or letterhead and (2) open the back cover to print letterhead and labels. Pros: Fast duplex printing Good image quality Quiet mode Easy to set up wireless printing Excellent color rendering for this price point Really good value for the money This is a high quality, easy to use printer. While I ding the printer for having controls that aren’t as easy to find as I would like, it is far easier to control this printer than the Lexmark that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for large jobs that need crisp images
customer_reviews.text: This printer was exactly what I hoped it would be. Run a small business, and we got sick of paying exorbitant fees to print out our flyers. So we decided to try out this Brother printer. So far it is perfect. Super easy to setup and connect to computers over wifi. Prints super fast. Images are almost clearer on the page than on the computer screen. Even using cheap printer paper the flyers look great. And with a slight gloss on the paper, they are incredible. Will update if anything goes wrong, but so far it is great. Ink seems to be holding up pretty well too.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Very fast but also irritatingly slow
customer_reviews.text: In most respects, it was a fine printer. However, perhaps it was a defective unit because it would pause 25-30 seconds between each document. Since I often send multiple 1-page documents to the printer, one right after the other, it was very frustrating watching it print for 5 seconds, sit for 30, print for 5, sit for 30, etc. When it was printing a multi-page document it would spit out one page right after another, no pause, so that was nice. If it didn't have this weird pause, I would have definitely given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great color printer
customer_reviews.text: Great color printer. Have used it for a couple weeks and no issues. The color print density is much much better than any inkjet I've owned. Printed several thirty page booklets that were printed on letter size paper, folded and stapled to make 8 1/2 by 5 1/2 inch finished booklets. One of the pages had color photos and was very pleased with the quality. The covers were printed on 67 pound cover stock. The printer handled the cover stock well although I did not try to use auto duplexing on the heavy paper. Fed one side thru first from the fold down tray and fed the second side from the same tray. The print quality was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Reedy

customer_reviews.title: Plan on buying more toner at EXACTLY 1800 pages
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine color printer. But conveniently, at EXACTLY 1800 color pages (the # Brother says the toner cartidges should last), this printer starts whining that it's time to send Brother another $210. The color pages we print have barely any color at all. I suspect that if you printed a single color pixel on 1800 pages, the printer would start telling you it's low on ink. And for that little piece of trickery and fraud, you get only 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Leaves streaks on color prints.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because it could supposedly print on 80 lb paper. It will print it but it leaves streaks and pressure marks on color prints. I used the correct supported paper (several actually). Prints fine on regular paper but then so does every other printer. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: informed-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don't Rely on Amazon Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Approximately 90 days after I purchased the printer from Amazon, it was necessary to change the first toner cartridge. None of the cartridges available for this model would fit in the printer because of a defective part on the tray inside the printer that holds the cartridges. Brother verified that there was a defective part in the printer but Amazon would not accept the printer for return/replacement because it was outside of Amazon's 30-day return window. I contacted Amazon customer service for assistance and they did not believe me when I described the defective part or provide any remedies. Given the cost of the printer and the concurrence from Brother that the printer is defective, Amazon's customer service is non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Steward

customer_reviews.title: Please reconsider other options.  This one is not for you.
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this. I did all my research. spent hours and this one showed in various as the one to get for a small home office. Alas - does not work wirelessly, very very glitchy. knocks out wireless connection mutliple times ad i have to restart my wireless for the printer to recognize it. No other device in my network has this issue. Again, i then took it wired, same issue, in this case, keeps saying printer not connected, and i have to disconnect and reconnect multiple times for printer to be recognized.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I have ever owned!  Don't buy a Brother!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked fine until I needed to put a replacement cartridge in. Then it stopped working. Brother says the drum is defective. They promised me a new in 2-3 business days on the phone. Then sent an email stated in will be 4 weeks because the drums are out of stock. That is probably due to Brother flooding the market with defective product. It doesn't matter how good or economical a printer is if it doesn't work. DO NOT BUY!!! My printer's serial number is L8J232241. It was purchased through Amazon on 1/9/19.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Franco

customer_reviews.title: Color prints look really good, I mean
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month of office use with 8 users, it's working out really well. The printer works well with different types of paper configured for each tray and automatically pulls from the correct tray. Not too noisy or smelly (you know that old laser printer smell). Color prints look really good, I mean, you won't confuse them for a professional print, but they look good. No issues, no jams or anything yet.
customer_reviews.author: mmmatt!

customer_reviews.title: What a brilliant, brilliant
customer_reviews.text: What a brilliant, brilliant, brilliant machine. Had it plugged in, attached to WiFi and running in 5 minutes. First page only printed half of the page, took the cartridges out and shook them to settle the ink granules (I'm sure all the ink was on one side from shipping) and no issues. Even has paper handling to print 2 sided. Bought this after reading extensive reviews that said this was the cheapest to own and most reliable and couldn't be happier after dealing with two second hand ink jets. Worth. Every. Penny.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Good black text, questionable gray/color text quality though
customer_reviews.text: On the fence with this printer. Had it for about a month now. 1. It prints fast 2. It's very heavy 3. No paper jams so far 4. Black text is very crisp BUT... I am experiencing awful print quality with gray text. It always seems to print the gray text with a patchy, pixelated, and faded appearance. It may be related to the paper I'm using but not sure. I kind of suspect they aren't handling the color mixing correctly for gray. Will try some other brands of paper and report back when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: OK but some issues
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is an acceptable, though kinda mediocre printer. I wanted to avoid HP (after a bad experience with last HP printer - a problem requiring a replacement part that cost double the price of the printer) PROS: Easy to speak with Brother techies* Acceptable output Simple install CONS: curls paper (DESPITE having chosen "reduce curl" in printer settings pretty slow (or al least slower than my similar spec/priced HP) seems to have trouble printing some docs - esp. MS Word: 2011 & 2016- often prints out incomplete page (even if saved as PDF) - document prints fine from my Canon. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Grizelda

customer_reviews.title: High Quality...The Laser Printer that Could!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Printer. I bought this as a replacement for my business where I print my own labels for my retail shop. I love the screen on it. It was up and running in 5 minutes and I could actually lift it out of the box. So far so good. Print quality is superb....does take up a little space but all laser printers do!
customer_reviews.author: K. Bruning

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far...
customer_reviews.text: When I was searching for a good color laser for home use I forgot to look at the actual size measurements. This thing is full size. It looked a lot smaller in the picture. Oops! It is certainly not fitting on the shelf as I originally envisioned! It seems to work great though. I have the the whole family set up to use it over the network. Wired networking took a couple of tries before it took. Just let the software do the search and install and don't bother trying to do Ports and such like in the "old days". It works nicely with Windows 10 and Linux Mint. I haven't tried WiFi yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dwarf Eight

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant! Fabulous! just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Looked long and hard for a great printer. This one is tops with a terrific price, too. Hooked up to my iMac, and the wireless and BT printing is perfect. Works just as advertised. It's a big machine, the same size of older printed that also did 11" x 17", but this one does not print wider than 9", well worth the investment - QUALITY and VALUE. Been using for over 6 months, a new workhorse. Great print interface on Apple products and Android tables, chrome books and phones. Have not tested any pc's...do they still make those? If you found this review helpful, please click the button...right there..THX.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as an HP laser with Apple through wireless, especially when hooked to an Airport Express through USB.
customer_reviews.text: I was an all A student of Graphic Design in the early 2000's which isn't easy to do. I wish I had, had this instead of my Epson. The epson gives more lifelike print quality for your portfolio, but everyone in the real world uses a laser for mock ups. Who has time to mess with an ink jet printer with clients. This printer is amazing and comes close to matching epson, although the colors are less vivid than ink jet. I can't believe the price. I CAN'T. I now use this daily with Amazon and UPS pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uses only Brother toner cartridges
customer_reviews.text: This printer works fine until it runs out of toner. When it did, I tried two highly ranked third-party toner cartridge packages from Amazon, and both failed. The printer would not recognize the yellow replacement cartridge as being full. Toner reset did not fix the issue. My conclusion is that only Brother cartridges will work, and I consider their prices to be exorbitant. I returned the printer. So, don't buy this printer unless you are willing to commit to high prices for consumables.
customer_reviews.author: Bob McCrory

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when UPS delivered our printer. We use Brother printers at work, and I was looking forward to having one at home. Unfortunate, after getting everything set up, I get black marks about every inch on the right side of everything I print. I can’t find a number to contact Brother and the support on their website is terrible. I will be returning this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Shissler

customer_reviews.title: Constant paper jams and poor access.
customer_reviews.text: Total junk product. Constantly jams. Poorly designed access. Nearly impossible to remove jammed paper from inaccessible printing areas. I really detest this printer and regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: cse-amz

customer_reviews.title: I only like jam on toast.
customer_reviews.text: For the life of me I cannot get this machine to stop jamming. Every time I try to print double sided, it jams. Tech support was nice, but were not able to resolve the issue. New drivers didn’t resolve the issue. The printer sits on top of a table so a level surface is not the issue. I give up. I’ve printed a total of about 350 pages and now it’s low on toner. So much for the 3000 page before toner replacement claim. It doesn’t scan, which was my fault for not checking. It’s still extremely annoying to not have a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: We hadn't updated our printer in years because our reliable high volume printer just kept soldiering on. However with an updated, new computer, we needed a wireless high volume printer for our business. After much research, we chose this one because of it's advertised speed and overall economy. I had no idea how slow our old printer was until we started using this one yesterday! VERY pleased with my choice due to speed and expect good results with the economic value as well. Also, it's a good bit bigger than I realized, but that's not a problem. It just requires a little more desk space which was easy.
customer_reviews.author: LadyC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer DO NOT BUY.... Spend you money on a good HP that will last
customer_reviews.text: Printer toner is expensive and then it would drop off my network all the time or not wake up when it was time to print and now it just decided to no longer turn on so no power or nothing. I should have known better than to try and save a couple of dollars and buy a bother printer. I have had HP Laser printers for many years and never had issues like this. Never again Brother. Also when you call in for support they are clueless as well and are no help.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: but I really like it. I had an earlier model and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this printer for a few months, but I really like it. I had an earlier model and it was a work horse. The previous model had a lot of paper jam issues, that this one does not have - thankfully. I use a lot of different thickness paper in the multipurpose tray and it works like a champ. Couldn't be more pleased, so far.
customer_reviews.author: bassetcrazy

customer_reviews.title: Curls Paper Like Crazy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer because I wanted a solid color laser printer that could produce photo like prints. It does that perfectly fine. Problem is, it curls thicker paper like crazy. Like, it u-bends thick paper. I should have listed to the other reviews about the envelopes curling. I'm disappointed in my purchase and I kinda want to send the printer back. Yes, there's an option to "reduce paper curl" in the printer settings. I've used it with and without and I legit can't tell the difference. If you care about whether or not your paper will be flat, don't get this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Great colors but the resolution isn't very crisp
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the attached photos--the colors are great but the resolution isn't very sharp. For office use it's perfect. The installation was easy. It doesn't come with usb printer chord though lucky me I have some with me. Wireless connection is easy to setup basically run the installation-cd and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The printer did not print centered when duplex printing
customer_reviews.text: Brother tried to figure out what was wrong, but after hours on the phone and 3 phone calls later, no answer to the question. The told me the files I used were wrong and to blame for that. I used different design programs and made crosses in the center, printed duplex and it never fit. No I bought the "CANON Color Imageglass". It is not only under $200, it prints so much better and clearer. What was printed gray with the brother is now in the right color tones. Since I researched online, I found out I was not the only person with this problem. Save yourself some money and buy another printer.....
customer_reviews.author: Ein zufriedener Kunde!

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended for Several Reasons
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is fine. I cannot get after market toner. It's on back order everywhere. I need it for business and haven't had it for too long. It still has black toner but won't print at all, even in black and white, because other colors are low. Ridiculous. Finally, it destroys envelopes. They look horrible after printing. I can't remember the last time I gave any product or service a bad review, if ever, but I am not happy with this printer and wish I had gone with an HP, like the one that this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: SSSantos

customer_reviews.title: Works fine until the fuser roller overheats after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the fuser roller overheated after 18 months and now all the paper comes out wrinkled/embossed, despite the fuser unit being less than 1/3 the way through it's lifespan according to the printer itself. Brother used to make quality printers that lasted a long time, but in the past few years, the quality has slipped a lot and the printers start having problems soon after the warranty runs out. Does anyone make printers that last a while any more?
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. I purchased it awhile back but I waited until I used up the toner on my old printer. It was easy to setup and connect to my wireless Network system. Fast and very nice printing. But when you install the printer go to the Brother’s site and download the latest drivers. If you are using it on a Mac make sure you use the “CUP” drivers and not the default. Or you want be able to “Duplex”. Or use all of it features.
customer_reviews.author: Nwilliams401

customer_reviews.title: Great printer & superior software / setup / networking features
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best printer we have ever owned - and over the years we've tried just about all the major brands. We run a small business and we have a college student in house, so this thing gets a good workout. What really impresses me about this one is (a) print quality is outstanding (b) the software setup on Windows10 was absolutely seamless, and (c) ease of networking printing. Everyone in the house can print from any machine - the printer shows up on the wireless LAN automatically. Any Windows or Chrome client can print wirelessly. I have had other brands where networking setup was really cumbersome. Not this one! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: joby

customer_reviews.title: High quality, efficient, & toner savings
customer_reviews.text: I've had Lexmarks, Epsons, Canons, & Brother printers over the years for all different types of uses. Brother has always had excellent customer service and quality. Perfect use for a home or small-sized business. The decision to go with this printer in particular after reading hundreds of reviews on various printers was great quality with a lower expense of toner over time. I always write reviews weeks/months/years after purchase. Happy with product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycen

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, easy install, so far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I got this one because I wanted a wireless connection. It was quick and easy to set up and worked well from the start. I don't do a lot of printing but when my family prints stuff we want it to "just work". So far this printer is doing fine. The only down-sides: It's a little bigger and heavier than I would like and I do wish it had a larger black toner because we really don't do that much color.
customer_reviews.author: Annette J.

customer_reviews.title: Won't print on cardstock!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this computer for 2 days and it's going back. I have wasted so much paper trying to color print on card stock. Even when I select the thick paper setting it ruins my prints. When I send a file to print it also pulls the paper through and prints garbled text, once again ruining my paper. Can't wait to repackage this baby and return it. Hopefully the next printer will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rain King

customer_reviews.title: Great home office printer, until it died 14 months in.
customer_reviews.text: Great home office printer. Works well on Wi-Fi. Good print quality. Good speed. Duplex capable. Decent print speed. Very happy with it. UPDATE: Buy the extended service. 2 months after being out of warranty printer died. No power. Contacted Brother who put me in touch w repair service who basically said just get another printer. Home office. Lightly used. Never even ran out of starter toner before it died.
customer_reviews.author: ALAN E BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Garbage printer for labels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to print labels for my home business. The multipurpose tray is fickle; sometimes it will print labels aligned correctly. Other times, I am fighting the MP try to accept the label paper. This is a brand new printer. This was a waste of money. Don't buy this printer for LABELS period. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I wasted my money; don't do the same.
customer_reviews.author: J. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and wish I could turn back Time
customer_reviews.text: Overall the printer is good if you're not looking to use us in a production fashion for printing color booklets or fliers or anything else in that manner.I personally found this to be extremely disappointing as now I have to find a different printer that can handle high resolution and colors and being able to handle different saturation levels better this printer has wasted a massive amount of paper toner and my time trying to fine-tune the print quality if you're looking for an everyday so so printer this one will do just fine if you're looking for anything beyond everyday minor printing this is not the printer for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff's repair corner

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Scan
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I paid $430 for a printer/copier that doesn't scan... I thought it would, but going through it I see now that it doesn't. Probably my fault, but it should have been highlighted in the page somewhere. I assumed a printer at this price point would scan... Haven't decided yet if I'll return it and get one that does or just suck it up and keep this one but purchase a cheaper one with scanning functionality
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall a well price, high speed, laser printer
customer_reviews.text: Only one complaint I have for this printer is extreme page curls with card stock prints. I have another laser printer I use for card stock prints and with the same card stock paper the paper does not curl. I'm sure its the Brother laser printer causing paper curls. Otherwise, I would recommend this printer and would purchase again. I print between 5,000 to 10,000 prints each month and after 6 months this printer is still doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot G

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good
customer_reviews.text: Like many, I have a love-hate relationship with my printer. This one is a big step up from my older more expensive HP printer. The ink is cheaper, and the interface actually works. Takes smaller sized paper than the HP and rarely jams. Color quality is not as good, even after calibration, so if you need photographic quality, there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value color laser; FULL TONER KIT
customer_reviews.text: Great home/small business color laser. Maybe not as good image quality as HP but it comes with A FULL SET OF CARTRIDGES. Not this HP crap where they want to to but a $400 on a printer then immediately spend another $300 on toner.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: So far a great color laser printer
customer_reviews.text: Update: 2/3/20 Still works without any issues. Update: 8/19/19 This printer has functioned flawlessly, not a single paper jam yet. It has done a couple of firmware updates with no problems. It prints every time! I bought this laser printer 28 Mar 19, so far it has been great. Easy setup and has just been working. The print quality has been good too. No Paper jams so far. It has automatically done two firmware updates, with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist Hut

customer_reviews.title: Fast as lightning and does come with toner
customer_reviews.text: First Amazon shows it does not come with toner but it actually does so don’t spend $100 buying extra. It lasts a year or so for an average home user. So nice to print in seconds! What a treat!! I was confused setting this up but my neighbor seemed to whip right through it so set up would depend on your knowledge of printers. My iphone automatically picked it up as did my laptop without and special downloading. Thats new and refreshing!
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is AMAZING! I had it set up and printing in 10 minutes. To my suprise, the ink cartridges provided handled hundreds of pages on the first day and still aren't empty. The color prints are vibrant and exactly what I was looking for. Connecting to the WIFI was fast and simple also. This printer does not disappoint in the slightest. If you're trying to decide which printer to get.... go with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: ENVELOPES ARE NOT EASY TO PRINT
customer_reviews.text: What they don't tell you is that, to print an envelope, you have to open the back of the machine, flip two levers, and leave the back of the machine open (making the space needed for an already large printer even deeper). Once the envelopes are printed, you have to flip the levers back and close the back of the printer. You have to do this for EVERY ENVELOPE ALL DAY LONG. Also, it takes at least a full minute to wake from "sleep mode," so there is drag before it prints something for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lights2

customer_reviews.title: does not line up images when printing double sided
customer_reviews.text: does not print full bleed. So you have to leave white around your images then cut them off later. But when you try to cut off the white edges, you'll learn the hard way that this printed does not line up images properly front and back when printing double sided (regardless of whether you try to print duplex or one side at a time). One side of the paper will come out slanted.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not an upgrade, and not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Set-up is frustrating, support poor. Lots of connection issues, and not a supported printer for Asus AC3100. Still cannot get it to print from either a Chromebook or any of the ipads, despite claims of compatibility. Access to reports etc is convoluted and not at all intuitive.Sorry I "upgraded" from my HL-4570 - I wanted the compatibility with Chromebooks and ipads, and I received neither, and while it may technically print faster, by the time you add in the processing time total print time is actually longer, not shorter! It takes FOREVER for prints to start!
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Fast with Great Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: After buying HP inkjet printers for years, I finally took the plunge and upgraded to color laser. The reviews of this unit were largely responsible for my purchase of this. I could not be more pleased. It is very fast and the image quality is outstanding. I print a lot of color documents for work and the print quality on this is spectacular, regardless of what type of paper I print on. The only drawback may be noise, but this is a business-class printer so a little noise is to be expected. If you're trying to decide, pull the trigger and you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: P.W.

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Pictures all pink and red and mottled and dithered. Also their instructions were unclear how to remove all of the shipping restraints. Part of one of the retainig clips for the cartridges popped out while removing the orange splastic material also but was fairly easy to snap back into place.
customer_reviews.author: furfoot

customer_reviews.title: Poor Firmware update download from Brother. Rendered Printer Useless
customer_reviews.text: Printer stopped working after purchasing new When I did a firmware which basically rendered Printer totally dead Unable to recover
customer_reviews.author: EUGENIO MENENDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: After years of HP printer use tried Brother. Easy initial set up and easy to print to... BUT HORRIBLE quality. After hours with brother support they concluded a bad black toner. It was replaced but ALL graphic prints have issues. Odd border around pictures, odd lines around objects. At this point only good for black and white text.
customer_reviews.author: sdemw

customer_reviews.title: Look at cost of ink before buying
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive and a lot heavier compared to what I thought I was getting. I wanted a good quality laser printer in our home office. Should of done more research and that’s on me. Cost $400 to replace the ink which we haven’t had to do yet but we found a generic company that sells it for much cheaper. Overall I’m happy with the purchase. The printer is a lot better than what we had.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Printer won't power up, less than two years old, POS.
customer_reviews.text: Had good luck with black and white Brother printers, so spent $350 on this color laser printer. Happy as a clam for the first 18 months, now it will not even power on. Went online for a fix - appears to be a common problem among various Brother printers. The online fix of unplugging the AC, holding down the power button, plugging back in - blah blah blah did not work for this unit. VERY disappointed, will not buy Brother anything again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Muller

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about 3months! Now any type of pictures are no longer clear or consistent! We mainly use for just printing word documents so I will live with it for awhile longer!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan F.

customer_reviews.title: One month and I'm still pleased
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, comes with toner and print quality is excellent. I've only been using it a month, and I'm not a heavy printer. This was my choice based on the features, cost, print quality and manufacturer. I've got light printing needs, so I can't attest to how much of a work horse it is, but it runs 50 page duplex documents quickly and easily, and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Teahouse Fox

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer. Ink doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is easy to setup and print to via wireless, even from a phone. Print quality is decent for most color prints, but don't expect photo quality. My only complaint is that the included cartridges didn't even last 1500 black and white pages, when it says the yield is 3,000 BW /1,800 color.
customer_reviews.author: Amz503201

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: It just sets up itself as long as you unpack it properly with removing all the tapes holding stuff inside the machine and outside. You absolutely need no extra skills in any subject to make this thing work. I had a Dell 3130CN and it is more than 6 years old and I was under the impression that things got faster since then, however this one is even slower and that's why I dropped 1 star from its rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ari L.

customer_reviews.title: The boring solid printer than reliably makes life more colorful. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: It prints. Prints in color. Paper goes in. Printed paper comes out. Drivers can be downloaded from Brother if you need them. Sleeps quietly until summoned. More reliable than other brands and good price per page. No selling mortgage required for print ink. Boring. Solid. Reliable. No gimmicks. Love it. I wonder if it will last > 10 years like my last Brother laser printer? (which still prints - its fans are just a bit noisy now...)
customer_reviews.author: L. A.

customer_reviews.title: Wayyyy Toooo Slowwww
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer for one year to the day. (Purchased 9/30/2018.) This must be my 6th or 7th Brother printer (at least) so generally am a fan. But just logged into Amazon to look for an alternative because I just cannot deal with how slow this printer is. (Then decided to write this review to let others know.) Situation is no different even if I use the cable and not the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: JYP

customer_reviews.title: Great printer - be sure to install latest firmware.
customer_reviews.text: After buying the Brother MFC-L2740DW a few years ago, we had to replace our old color laser - This one works great after the firmware update. The printing speed is great, and 2-sided color prints are spectacular. I was able to print to it from my iPhone also. Overall its a great machine!
customer_reviews.author: HowardH

customer_reviews.title: Just What Print Doctor Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Although I have used the machine sparingly to this point, I immediately noticed that color quality was very good. Printer is speedy. Fully featured for my needs (home use). Came with standard toner carts, rather than intro carts that are soon depleted and cost arm and three legs to replace. All in all, very pleased with purchase. Brother seems to build quality printers (I have monochrome Brother that's flawless). Would highly recommend this unit to others.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Blues

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon color laser printer for years and started having issues with it so I purchased this one. It was easy to set up, works with my wireless internet and prints BEAUTIFULLY and VERY FAST. I print labels with it mostly for products that I sell. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Color printouts are wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought the second paper tray, now kicking myself. Looked at all the literature and still can't find out if it can be added. The dual tray version of this printer has a different model number. Color printouts are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: boneah

customer_reviews.title: Sent wrong printer
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how L8360 looks like L3290 but was sent the wrong printer the 1st time, week later the correct one shows up. Bought it to print on vinyl, seems to do a good job. It is kinda slow to receive info from computer. I will update as I use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Slick 1

customer_reviews.title: Good small office printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for a HL-4570CDW that got fried in a power surge. This is a much better printer in terms of output and features. Color rendition is a bit off, but no laser will match inkjet photo printers. Cheap 3rd party toner cartridges make this very cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: JeffS

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Just about every printer I've ever owned has had serious mechanical difficulties, often making very simple projects into long, drawn-out swear word laced hours of pain and suffering. The most difficult thing about this printer is getting it out of the box. It was extremely easy to set up, the ink lasts for quite a lot longer than its inkjet cousins, it has yet to jam even once (knocks on wood), and prints wirelessly from all our devices from all over the house. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Sands

customer_reviews.title: great work house printer
customer_reviews.text: this is a great work horse printer. Keep in mind this does not print borderless, currently there is no laser printer that does borderless color printing. however the ink on this one is great. ive printed almost 2000 pages and it is just now giving me toner low signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mansa Musa

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: If you have wifi, it takes maybe 6 minutes to connect and be printing. I actually was surprised at how easy it was. Most of this stuff requires studying manuals, going to internet, screwing with your computer settings. Not this one. II have always bought Brother and they very simply just work
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Karr

customer_reviews.title: Caution when buying printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked beautifully for about a month and now I am getting an error that there is no paper in the tray (paper tray is full) or I am getting an error that there is a paper jam when it is clear. I have turned it on and off but nothing seems to be helping
customer_reviews.author: Anne C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Tray 2 Error
customer_reviews.text: Brand new printer out of the box and Tray 2 doesn't work. It keeps showing an error that the tray isn't installed: "Take out Tray 2 and push it back in firmly". I tried reinstalling the tray, it still doesn't work. Does Brother no longer perform quality control any more? Be prepared to spend 30mins repackaging this pile of junk and hauling all 50+ lbs to your UPS store. Amazon isn't any help.
customer_reviews.author: Aelver

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Buy now.
customer_reviews.text: I am in total awe with this laser printer. $300 is total worth for the printer. Bought it just over a week, and have been using for personal, school, and work. Print speed is fast, print quality for black is amazing, print quality for color is equal to a high end ink printer. I was skeptical when buying If the quality of color will be good or not. I am sold. My first laser printer, and proud of my choice :) If you thinking about buying, then I can only say is: Buy now. Stop thinking. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Texan Girl

customer_reviews.title: Receiving Data death Error- Printer dead after 1yr 5mo.  Out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: After just over a year, we now have an unrecoverable error that just says receiving data. Printer cannot function now and the customer support basically says the printer needs t be taken to a service center. We print very little and maybe have gone through 2 reams of paper since purchase. It's essentially a recycling item now and we got just over a year out of our $300+ purchase. Will not repeat buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Quality of print is surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: As described will gladly do business with again. Printer update of an earlier review. Quality of this printer is still very good however, it does not handle glossy 80lb 210gsm well. My revised recommendation will be 65lb glossy cover 175gsm or simply 10pt gloss cover.
customer_reviews.author: DMJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the HP Color Laser printer, and had nothing but problems. Then I bought this Brother printer. Absolutely no comparison in quality, the Brother printer was by far the best!! Installation was simple, and still going strong! Yes, I would recommend this printer hands down!
customer_reviews.author: wizcompter

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for higher volume printing. Doesn't scan, copy or fax however.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an HP bubble jet printer. They use up the expensive cartridges too fast and do not last long. This one prints in color very well. If you need a printer that can handle several hundred pages a month, this is a good solution. It doesn't copy, scan or FAX however.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Donohue

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: All of a sudden the printer won't power on. No help, no repair facilities nearby (I live just outside of NYC) . I tried the power reset but to no avail. Very disappointing. Call tech support and wait forever.. Now I am trying to find a way to dispose of this. I had high hopes for Brother after being an HP user for years but now I am staying away from the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K.

customer_reviews.title: Great print quality, but slooowwwww
customer_reviews.text: For single sided documents this printer is decently fast (after it wakes up). But double-sided is slower than mud. Wish I had known before I purchased. Love the low cost per page though. That makes it all worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and get going
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box, removed the packing material plugged the printer in and set up wireless. 30 minutes tops. later wired a cable.to the router and now we are sharing the printer on the wired network. Fast, printouts look great, and drivers work well to control paper source, double sided, and page size. Only had it for a few weeks but love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail and easily put it together next to my desk. It is a fast printer which can print double sided which I really like. It prints very neatly and has many options on how you could print it. I also like how it can print in color. So far it has worked every time I have tried to use it and I have had zero difficulties with it. The toner is lasting a good bit of time - I print at least 2 pages of paper a day and so far (14 days) I am doing well on toner. I highly recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best in Class Performance. Across the board.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Seamless support for Apple Print. Solid PostScript support (and I’m a PostScript / PPD developer). Reasonable size, weight. Great paper handling (for a office class device). EXCEPTIONAL power efficiency and sleep manners. Supply costs are reasonable (though certainly not cheap).
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: BLACK BANDS ON COPIES
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it is putting black bands about an inch wide all the way down every page. I have run a number of pages through it thinking it might be from shipping, but no difference. The color is OK for a laser. but the bands make it unusable for business.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: stopped working only 8 months later
customer_reviews.text: This printer was bought brand new in April and simply stopped working 8 months later. There is no remedy. No way to fix it. RIP OFF!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: good printer, easy installation, trusted quality. but not good for card stock /heavy paper and image quality not best . for everything else recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: A must for small business
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best printer I've ever used. I have a small business and can count on my Brother machine to print quality work. It was also easy to set up, use and no paper jams ( a great feature)!
customer_reviews.author: Chieri

customer_reviews.title: Good printer but no scanner/copier
customer_reviews.text: Print quality was nice for high quantity printer. But we returned because it didn’t have a scanner or copier.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home office - wireless printing from iphone!
customer_reviews.text: The brother printer is more than I expected. I love that I can wirelessly print from my iPhone with limited configuration. The print quality is good. I bought a nicer printer paper to avoid wrestling with jams. I print wirelessly from windows, macbook, and iPhone with no issue. I don't know how long the ink will last...
customer_reviews.author: Chaya

customer_reviews.title: Looks like I just got a defective unit
customer_reviews.text: With less than 50 pages printed the unit started producing pages that were faded on the left side. After troubleshooting with Brother for hours along with lots of internet research (looks like this issue is common) I was informed that the problem was with the cartridges that shipped with the printer. I was also informed these cartridges have a 90 day warranty which we were just outside of and new ones would have to be purchased. UPDATE: After speaking with a manager and escalating the issue, they have agreed to take care of the issue free of charge. Aaaaaand the problem wasn't the cartridges. Dealing with customer service to see if this unit will ever work.
customer_reviews.author: Da5id

customer_reviews.title: Worked as it should
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old HP color printer with this Brother. Have really liked the monochrome Brother printers. They have functioned well and have given me a lot of "bang for the buck." So far this color printer is giving me the same service.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bensinger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and economical
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of Brother laser printer. I have been using to print some labels for my products and all my office documents for 3 small companies. I absolutely love it. This printer is very economical. Cartridges last forever and the quality of print is very good. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: sothern girl

customer_reviews.title: I love the consistent duplexing feature
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive printer. No complaints. Seamless with my network. I'm not sure I have had even one hitch. Runs circles around my HP 2025. Toner is expensive but I have purchased some Brand X and hopefully, it works. This is for the professional or serious home office need. I love the consistent duplexing feature.
customer_reviews.author: F. R. Vining

customer_reviews.title: great image quality, feeds all kinds of paper perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We're very pleased at the way this printer prints and with how it feeds all sorts of papers. It's a titch slower than the one it replaced, but the print dialog is so much faster it's about a wash. We disabled the Wifi because we run a secure wired network and don't want wifi entry points.
customer_reviews.author: Nerds Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this printer! Its colors are true, it's fast, two-sided copying is effortless! I can't win the fight to run it wirelessly, but I think that has more to do with my internet connection than the printer. It's the 1st Brother printer I've ever bought, and I'm so sorry I waited so long!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: When my HL-3170 decided to go on strike, I had to upgrade to something that can handle the print load. This printer prints clean, fast, and beautiful. The best part is... it auto update its own firmware once it connected to wifi and laptop/phones/ipad connect is a cinch.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: My office own a few of these printers and I needed one for my home office. The Brother printer was recommended by IT and it is a great printer for your home office.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow to prrint but copies look great
customer_reviews.text: This sits 8 feet from my computer so I am not sure what the delay is, but once it starts printing the rate is good. ualtiy is excellent. Highly recommended as an office copier.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Wife

customer_reviews.title: I Really Like This Printer
customer_reviews.text: Although I had a bit of trouble getting it to print Duplex (had to download a different driver), it's now working great. Quiet, fast printing, and the print quality is top quality. I printed a couple of pictures that were in color and they were nice, too. I do love the sleep mode.
customer_reviews.author: Millie Lee

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for 24 hours and already regret this purchase. Not only is it hard to set up but prints at a glacial pace. I would save my money and buy the cheapest printer on the market, it would be the same quality as this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Brother Business Color Laser Printer, HL-L8360CDW, Wireless Networking, Automatic Duplex Printing, Mobile Printing, Cloud printing, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description: Style:HL-L8360CDWOffices large and small in search of a dependable color laser printer should consider the Brother HL L8360CDW. This printer produces fast, high quality prints in both black and color at speeds up to 33 pages per minute. (1) The HL L8360CDW offers low cost output due to super high yield 6, 500 page replacement toner cartridges. (2) The Brother HLL8360CDW Business Wireless Laser Printer offers multiple connectivity options. Connect via wireless or Gigabit Ethernet network interfaces or print from popular mobile devices. (3) A 2. 7″ Touchscreen display offers easy menu navigation and printing from popular business cloud services including: Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, and more. (5) This Brother printer also has advanced security features such as, an integrated NFC card reader for easy badge authentication(4), and Active Directory support for network user authentication. The security features help protect against unauthorized device access and control costs by restricting printing on a per user or group basis. The HL L8360CDW is also Dash Replenishment–enabled. When you activate this feature, Dash Replenishment will continuously measure the toner level and order more from when it’s low. This unique Brother feature keeps busy office workspaces operating at peak efficiency, ensuring you don’t run out of toner. Brother is dedicated to superior customer service and offers a 1 year limited on the HL L6200DW business laser printer. We also offer free at your side support for the life of your product, featuring online, phone, or live chat assistance. (1)Based on one-sided printing. Change from default setting required. (2)Approximate cartridge yield in accordance with ISO/IEC 19798 (letter/A4). (3)Requires connection to a wireless network. (4)The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4. 4 or later. (5)Requires an Internet connection and an account with desired service.
feature_bullets: HIGH-QUALITY COLOR PRINTING: The Brother HLL8360CDW can print professional color documents at speeds of up to 33 ppm.
EASY CONNECTIVITY: Connect via wireless or Gigabit Ethernet network interfaces or wireless print from your mobile device(1).
AUTOMATIC DUPLEX PRINTING: The Brother Color Laser Printer features an automatic two-sided printing feature that can help save money and time.
DASH REPLENISHMENT ENABLED: Upon activation, Dash Replenishment measures the toner level and orders more from when it’s low. Standard Memory (MB): 512
BROTHER GENUINE TONERS: TN431: TN431BK, TN431C, TN431Y, TN431M, TN433: TN433BK, TN433C, TN433Y, TN433M, TN436: TN436, TN436BK, TN436C, TN436Y, TN436M
Connectivity Technology: USB, Gigabit Ethernet, Wi-Fi
Resolution: Up to 2400 x 600 dpi class

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars763 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
